parameters.name: ApplicationIds
parameters.description: Set of application IDs for the private access policy. A single policy supports up to 100 private access application IDs.

parameters.name: ApplicationType
parameters.description:
Application type of the private access policy. Values:
- **Application**: Application.
- **Tag**: Tag.

parameters.name: CustomUserAttributes
parameters.description: Set of custom user attributes for the private access policy, required when the user group type is **Custom**. Mutually exclusive with the user group ID set. The total number of custom user groups is limited to 10.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: Description of the private access policy. Length should be 1 to 128 characters, supporting Chinese and English letters (both uppercase and lowercase), and can include numbers, periods (.), underscores (_), hyphens (-), and spaces.

parameters.name: DeviceAttributeAction
parameters.description:
The execution strategy for not meeting the security baseline. Values:

- **Block**: Block.
- **Observe**: Observe.

parameters.name: DeviceAttributeId
parameters.description: The ID of the security baseline policy.

parameters.name: ModifyType
parameters.description:
The modification type of the private access policy. Values:
- **Cover** (default): Use the values of **ApplicationIds**, **UserGroupIds**, and **CustomUserAttributes** to overwrite the original application ID set, user group ID set, and custom user attribute set, respectively.
- **Append**: Add the values provided in **ApplicationIds**, **UserGroupIds**, and **CustomUserAttributes** to the original application ID set, user group ID set, and custom user attribute set, respectively.

parameters.name: PolicyAction
parameters.description:
Action of the private access policy. Values:
- **Block**: Block.
- **Allow**: Allow.

parameters.name: PolicyId
parameters.description:
ID of the private access policy. Value sources:
- [ListPrivateAccessPolicies](~~ListPrivateAccessPolicies~~): Batch query for private access policies.
- [CreatePrivateAccessPolicy](~~CreatePrivateAccessPolicy~~): Create a private access policy.

parameters.name: Priority
parameters.description: The priority of the private access policy. The number 1 indicates the highest priority. Range: 1~1000, with the maximum value being the total number of private access policies minus one.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description:
The status of the private access policy. Values:
- **Enabled**: Enabled.
- **Disabled**: Disabled.

parameters.name: TagIds
parameters.description: Set of tag IDs for the private access policy. A single policy supports up to 100 private access tag IDs.

parameters.name: TriggerTemplateId
parameters.description: The trigger template ID.

parameters.name: TrustedProcessGroupIds
parameters.description: Trusted process group ID.

parameters.name: TrustedProcessStatus
parameters.description:
Trusted process switch status. Values: 

- **Enabled**: On. 

- **Disabled**: Off.

parameters.name: TrustedSoftwareIds
parameters.description: Trusted Software ID.

parameters.name: UserGroupIds
parameters.description: Set of user group IDs for the private access policy, required when the user group type is **Normal**. Mutually exclusive with the custom user group set. A single policy supports up to 10,000 user groups, and a maximum of 2,000 user group IDs can be modified at once.

parameters.name: UserGroupMode
parameters.description:
User group type of the private access policy. Values:
- **Normal**: Normal user group.
- **Custom**: Custom user group.

parameters.name: ValidFrom
parameters.description: The start time when the zero trust policy takes effect, represented as a timestamp in seconds.

parameters.name: ValidTimeStatus
parameters.description: Switch status for effective time. Values: - **Enabled**: On. - **Disabled**: Off.

parameters.name: ValidUntil
parameters.description: The expiration time of the zero trust policy, in seconds timestamp.
